Parth, reflash your console to LT 3.0. If you do not have a decent disk drive get a benq or a liteon drive for your xbox: Note to check your xbox drive! I had a samsung drive in mine when I reflashed and most of my games were incompatible. Also, use a ihas burner (go on ebay and purchase one with burner max) This is the disk drive you want for burning games because it has the necessary chip to burn all xdg3 games: Note that you need a "b" model and research a little bit more if you have the money to spend and want a better version ihas "b" model.

Parth, burn another disk running it first through abgx360 again. go to the options tab and always make sure that verbosity level is medium and that you are set to the right region code in misc.

Also make sure that under the options setting that these are all checked:

-Check and create dvd file
-Check stealth
-verify if stealth patches
-check fix video padding
-use color
-check for any dvd style game datacorruption
-check for updates and also include the csv
-check game partition csv if needed

Make sure that in the autofix that everything is checked and that the angles are adjusted to 3 degrees from ccrt target

for dudelove420
it's not a good idea to change your DVD-rom(spoof)in you xbox console unless it's the same drive, unless  you want to get banned

And for tibyyy
i wouldn't even plug that in you probably have already been flagged for a ban, but you your Xbox is still letting you copy games to your hdd and your same saves work in another console you should be fine. you should put your DVD-ROM back to stock firmware, update the Xbox 360 dashboard to the newest one and the flash to 3.0 lt  and the make sure you at least  use abgx to test your iso's before and after you burn them. but for the new games that are over 7.8gb you will need a ihas 124XX version b to burn them properly


and if you can't game the game working make sure you always manually update the ss.bin and dmi.bin
